intro: Coussapoa williamsii, commonly known as Williams' coussapoa, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous areas with cool climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
